Event.0: "Crash My Party" 4th studio album by Luke Bryan is released (Billboard Album of the Year 2014)
Event.1: American super-swimmer Michael Phelps wins 3 gold medals, all in world record time, in the one day at the Beijing Olympics; 200m I/M (1:54.23), 200m butterfly (1.52.03) and 4 x 200m freestyle relay (6:58.56)
Event.2: American cooking expert Julia Child—who brought the art of French cooking to a vast number of Americans through her books and, especially, her programs on public television, where she became known for her humour and hearty voice—died at age 91.
Event.3: The Games of the XXVIII Olympiad opened in Athens, which had hosted the first modern Summer Games in 1896.
Event.4: New York Yankees baseball player Mickey Mantle died in Dallas, Texas.
Event.5: "Bonnie and Clyde", directed by Arthur Penn and starring Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway, is released
Event.6:
Janet Yellen
American economist
was born
Event.7: Evangelist Billy Graham (24) weds philanthropist and Christian author Ruth Bell (23) in Montreat, North Carolina
Event.8: The 'Manhattan Project' commences, under the direction of US General Leslie Groves: its aim - to deliver an atomic bomb
Event.9: Second Sino-Japanese War: Japanese forces begin the Battle of Shanghai, a conflict that will last 3 months and involve 1 million troops
Event.10:
Fidel Castro
political leader of Cuba
was born
Event.11: Comedian Stan Laurel (36) marries 1st wife actress Lois Neilson (30)
Event.12: Cuban political leader Fidel Castro, who transformed his country into the first communist state in the Western Hemipshere, was born.
Event.13: Famed racehorse Man o' War suffered the only defeat of his career.
Event.14: The U.S. Army took control of the Philippine port of Manila during the Spanish-American War.
Event.15:
Bert Lahr
American actor
was born
Event.16:
John Logie Baird
British inventor
was born
Event.17: Prime Minister of Canada Wilfrid Laurier (26) weds Zoé Lafontaine (27) in Montreal, Canada
Event.18: American markswoman Annie Oakley—who starred in Buffalo Bill's Wild West show, where she was often called “Little Sure Shot”—was born.
Event.19:
Annie Oakley
American markswoman
was born
Event.20: Prussia joins Anglo-Dutch alliance to form Triple Alliance to prevent spread of Russo-Swedish War of 1788-90
Event.21: Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens discovers Martian south polar cap
Event.22: Buddhist monks from Kyōto's Enryaku Temple set fire to 21 Nichiren temples throughout Kyoto in the Tenbun Hokke Disturbance. (Traditional Japanese date: July 27, 1536).
Event.23: Spanish conquistadors under Hernán Cortés capture Aztec Emperor Cuauhtémoc in Tenochtitlan marking the end of the Aztec Empire
Event.24:
Fall of the Aztec empire
On this day in 1521, Spanish conquistador Hernán Cortés captured Tenochtitlán (now Mexico City) after a 93-day siege, thereby ending the Aztec empire and winning Mexico for the crown of Spain.
